person.persName: Thomas Bell Monroe, Jr. (Sec State - Magoffin)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and soldier. Frankfort native. Son of Judge Thomas Bell Monroe, Sr. Educated at the University of Louisiana in New Orleans, Louisiana. Married Elizabeth C. Grier on November 15, 1859. Practiced law in Lexington, Kentucky, in 1849. Editor of the the Kentucky Statesman in Lexington in 1856. Elected mayor of Lexington in 1859. Secretary of State under Beriah Magoffin from August 30, 1859, to October 1, 1861. Major of the 4th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (C.S.A.). Killed in Action on April 6, 1862 at the Battle of Shiloh.
